msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers: line endings of a col. and the left part of the adjacent col. are preserved
On the front in the top intercolumnar space there are remains of 3 faded lines of writing by a second hand; on the back there are some numerals and a talent sign
On the front tiny remains of 15 line endings in col. 1 and 22 lines of writing in col. 2 in an experienced Late Ptolemaic book hand
Sometimes the intercolumnar space is reduced to zero: the so-called "Maas's Law" is very evident
The choral passage (which precedes line 208) was not written out as in prose but had pretensions to colometrization; it does not seem to preserve Aristophanes' colometrization
4 interesting variants which are not attested anywhere are preserved; the papyrus also preserves other variants of various merit
One accent is preserved; opposite line 230 there is a diagonal mark of obscure significance; iota adscript is sometimes written

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, on July 17, 1930; no. 2 in Bell's inventory

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
